chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joey D. Beard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joey D. Beard in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton states matter is resolved.  State gives recommendation.  Plea to 943.23(3m).    No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$243.00 costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
5 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive. TIME SERVED.  4 days credit.
Submit to DNA sample.
Cash bond applied.
Paperwork handed in court.

ADDRESS INFO for Joey D. Beard
Current: 2595 Hwy. H, Reedsburg, WI 53959 United States  (Effective: 08-18-2015)
Prior: 1173 Gale Ct 5, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965

Pre-trial conference at 09-04-2015 08:30 am.
Return date at 09-17-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joey D. Beard in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton requests reset as he was just appointed.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joey D. Beard in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE explains nonappearance earlier today.  Court questions DE whether he still intends to get counsel.  DE states he's trying to get a paid attorney.  Court quashes warrant and resets one more time and advises DE of right to counsel.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joey D. Beard not in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests warrant.  DE did go to PTC but fails to appear today.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant and cash bond forfeiture begin.

Pre-trial conference at 07-17-2015 08:30 am.
Return date at 07-31-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joey D. Beard in court.  Mike Albrecht and intern Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE would like an atty.  Court advises right to atty.  Time limits waived.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joey D. Beard by video from LEC with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Joey D. Beard in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests $500 cash bond w/conditions.  Atty Middleton responds.  Believes DE will qualify for PD appt when he applies.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits not waived.  $250.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/the Wrigley's or their residence and absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances unless he has a valid prescription.  May return to residence one time upon prior notice and with law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 10:15 am.
